data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You always face forward and will always walk forward. 10 forward steps return you to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around is to go around a location. To go left turns away from where you came from. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you turn around the direction you are walking at, you will likely come back to the starting point. If you are turning around from a direction, the directions ask you to take the same step(s) as when you were in the starting place. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You may repeat this sequence until you return to the starting point in the middle. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you’ ve already taken 10 steps, you should go to the starting spot. This will return you to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Turn around, take 7 steps. Now turn left. When you turn around, take 7 steps. Now turn around. When you turn around, take 7 steps. Now turn around.

Turn right. To return to the starting point you must take 8 steps first and 9 steps then take 2 steps next. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around means turn around. Turn around means take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person can take any number of steps forward in the instructions. 4 steps forward is the only number of steps you can take forwards. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around is a command that goes in reverse order but is a list of command that cannot be reversed. In this way, they would never get back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In the third step you take 1 step backward, not the previous one. So, the answer is yes.

A person facing forward can only take one step backwards in one direction. Every person always facing forward are facing up. One cannot take 2 steps left. Thus, the answer is No.

Then you should get to the starting point at 9 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A man can change his direction of walking through a maze. To reverse on one side, he must go one step forward first before returning to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

After one takes 3 steps right, the person is facing backward. After 3 steps right, the person is facing forward. So, the answer is No.

The shortest route will take you 8 steps. The larger the number of steps required, the more that will be needed to go back to the starting point. Therefore, the answer is No.

You take 6 steps back to first starting point. The first instructions is to take 10 steps. Turning around is the next step after taking 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn right in 7 steps. Turn around in 9 steps. Turn right in 7 steps. So, the answer is No.

Turnaround is an action that can be taken multiple times and return to the same point multiple times. Three steps is an action that can be taken three times and return to the same point multiple times. Therefore, the answer is No.

You cannot take 3 steps back to the starting point without turning around. So, the answer is No.

In first 3 steps, take 7 steps, 1 step backward. In second 3 steps, take 7 steps, 1 step right. In third 3 steps, take 7 steps, 1 step forward. In last 3 steps, take 8 steps, 5 steps backward. In final 3 steps, take 7 steps, 1 step forward, 5 steps right. So, the answer is yes.

Everytime you look forward you should always point your camera in the same direction. If you look to the left you'll go right to the starting point. This is very different than to look back and point your camera in the opposite direction. Thus, the answer is no.

Just by turning around you fumble the ball away from where you started. So, the answer is yes.

The six steps backwards is the same as the six steps left backwards. So, the answer is No.

Turn around takes 5 steps. Turn right takes 5 steps. To come back to the beginning turn right, take 5 steps and turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

The start point is always forward. When facing forward, you always take 1 forward step. If someone tells you to take 3 steps backward, then you'll see that they will take 3 steps backward. When a person tells you to take 2 steps reverse, you will be able to take one step backward. So, the answer is yes.

This is how the motion is done. When facing forward, the whole sequence should start and end with the person facing right. We take the first sequence, and return to where we started. So, the answer is Yes.
